channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How New-Collar Jobs Are Shrinking the Value of Degrees in Hiring
item.description: Some of the hottest jobs for skilled and experienced workers without college degrees pay more than six figures.

item.title: Meet Mira Nair, Zohran Mamdani’s 68-year-old mother who hit it big in Hollywood directing critical darlings like ‘Monsoon Wedding’
item.description: Nair is the first woman director to win the Venice Film Festival's top prize, and famously turned down WB's offer to direct the fourth Harry Potter mo...

item.title: Pinterest’s CEO says you’ll never be able to entirely filter out AI-generated content: ‘Not perfect for any platform’
item.description: Pinterest, a platform Futurism described as “being strangled by AI slop,” is not having a great day. The image-based social media company yesterday re...

item.title: Palantir says college is no longer a reliable training ground—so it hired 22 high school students instead: ‘Skip the debt. Skip the indoctrination.’
item.description: 22 Gen Zers are currently graduating from Palantir’s Meritocracy Fellowship, as CEO Alex Karp calls his company "the best credential in tech."

item.title: OpenAI’s new safety tools are designed to make AI models harder to jailbreak. Instead, they may give users a false sense of security.
item.description: OpenAI has open-sourced two AI safety classifiers that let enterprises more easily set their own guardrails. Experts say the move could improve transp...

item.title: KPMG’s new CEO joined as an intern 33 years ago. Now he wants to lure Gen Z back with a new office outfitted with moody lounges and a barista bar
item.description: KPMG is shrinking its New York footprint by 40% and betting on design—not mandates—to bring employees back to the office.

item.title: Experts Worry AI is Driving Layoffs, Even if It’s Not Delivering on its Promises
item.description: If AI proves inefficient, will companies rehire the talent they let go?

item.title: Corporate America is trying to tell us something about the economy, top analyst says: a 3-year recession for ‘much of the private economy’ ended in April
item.description: Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson was a lonely voice on Wall Street calling a "rolling recession" when others saw a boom. Now he sees a "rolling recovery."

item.title: Forget AI companions. This $249 AI ring lets you talk to yourself
item.description: There’s a new AI companion in town. Just don’t call it that. Launching today, Stream Ring is a wearable device that lets you capture your thoughts, br...

item.title: Pantone just made an AI tool that’s actually useful
item.description: Like every company in the world, Pantone thinks you really need AI help to do your job. Unlike most companies, however, the people who created the esp...

item.title: California votes yes on Proposition 50, giving Democrats a boost for House races in 2026
item.description: California voters approved new congressional district boundaries Tuesday, delivering a victory for Democrats in the state-by-state redistricting battl...

item.title: Trump heads to Miami to tout his economic agenda as U.S. consumers worry about the high cost of living
item.description: President Donald Trump is heading to Miami on Wednesday — the anniversary of his reelection to a second term — to speak to a forum of business leaders...

item.title: Mark Cuban Convinced Me to Quit My Job and Start a Company
item.description: More than a decade ago, Mark Cuban uttered a sentence at an Inc. Magazine event that changed the trajectory of my career.

item.title: Why Google Wants You to Be Conversational With Its Updated Maps App
item.description: A Google Maps redesign will leverage Google’s Gemini AI to make the app more like an insightful companion.

item.title: How Much Do I Need To Accommodate Employees’ Religion?
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.
